availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Clinton Bowen Fisk (St. Louis, Missouri, Brevet Major General (U.S.A.))

body.p: St. Louis, Missouri, brevet major general (U.S.A.). New York native. Married to Jenette C. Fisk. Father of Charles A. Fisk and May C. Fisk. Served in 33rd Missouri Volunteer Regiment (U.S.A.) as Colonel from September 5, 1862 to November 24, 1862. Commissioned Brigadier General on November 24, 1862. Brevetted Major General March 1865. Assistant commissioner of the Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands (Freedmenâ€™s Bureau) from July 1865 to June 1866.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis, St. Louis, p. 337.

Ezra J.Warner, Generals in Blue: Lives of Union Commanders (Baton Rouge, LA: Louisiana State University Press, 1964), 154-155.
"Records of the Field Offices for the State of Kentucky, Bureau of Refugees, Freedmen, and Abandoned Lands, 1865-1872," The National Museum of African American History & Culture, https://nmaahc.si.edu/object/sova_nmaahc.fb.m1904 (accessed March 24, 2020).
